snippet: You may not be able to keep your digital credentials from being stolen, but there are options for keeping a cyberthief from using them successfully.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column offers tips on adding layers of security to login process for online accounts, in aftermath of revelation that Russian hackers had gotten their hands on 1.2 billion username and password combinations; notes while it may be impossible to keep one's digital credentials from being stolen, one can make it hard for hackers to use them successfully.
lead_paragraph: You may not be able to keep your digital credentials from being stolen, but there are options for keeping a cyberthief from using them successfully.

headline.main: A Two-Step Plan to Stop Hackers
headline.print_headline: A Two-Step Plan to Stop Hackers
